Name: Tourmaline 8.20ct
Description:
Product Details
GEM TYPE: Tourmaline
TOTAL WEIGHT: 8.20ct
SIZE : (LxWxH): 22.1x6.2x5.8mm
SHAPE: Rough
COLOR: pink/blue
HARDNESS: 7-7.5
ORIGIN: Baikal
TREATMENT: Unheated / Untreated
ShortDescription:
Tourmaline

Although it has been known since ancient times in the Mediterranean region, the Dutch began importing them in 1703 from Sri Lanka. They named it Sinhalese "Turamali" - stone with mixed colors.

A very characteristic feature of tourmaline is the readiness with which it becomes electrified. By heating and subsequently cooling, as well as applying pressure, e.g. by rubbing, a tourmaline crystal will become electrically charged. It will then attract dust particles and small pieces of paper (pyro and piezoelectricity).

(Ca,K,Na)(Al,Fe,Li,Mg,Mn)3 (Al,Cr,Fe,V)6(BO3)3(Si,Al,B)6O18(OH,F)
meta-description: undefined rough Tourmaline 8.20ct (22.1x6.2x5.8mm) from Baikal - Not treated

Product Details

SHAPE: Oval
COLOR: Red
HARDNESS: 6.5-7.5
ORIGIN: Africa
TREATMENT: Unheated / Untreated
ShortDescription:
Hessonite Garnet

It is the orange variety of grossular garnet. Also known as the 'cinnamon stone' for its characteristic color.

The color is given by manganese, and it usually has a mellifluous and visually dense interior.
meta-description: Red oval Hessonite garnet 2.55ct (9x7x3.9mm) from Africa - Not treated
